intro: Salicornia nitens, commonly known as sea beans, is a halophyte plant adapted to saline environments. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that are often red or pink in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow. It thrives in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other areas with high salt content in the soil. Salicornia nitens is also used in some regions for culinary purposes, particularly in pickling or as a seasoning.
